data.title: Breakpoints not hit when attaching to a language server
data.body:
This has worked in the past but no longer works.

Here are the steps to reproduce the setup:
- `git clone git@github.com:Microsoft/vscode-tslint.git`
- open a Code instance on both the folder `tslint` and `tslint-server` 
- run `npm install` in both the `tslint` and the `tslint-server` folder
- **new** in the `tslint-server` run `npm run compile`
- in  `tslint-server` open `src/server.ts` and set a breakpoint in `#doValidate`
- in `tslint` press F5 to start a debug session
- in the extension development host open the folder `vscode-tslint/tslint-test` and then the file `arrow-parens.ts` see the screenshot below for the setup.
- you will see a tslint warning/green squiggle on line 1. This shows that the tslint-server is running
- switch to the `tslint-server` window and press F5 to attach to the server. Attaching to the server is successful. 
- switch to the extension development host and make an edit in `arrow-parens.ts`. This should trigger `doValidate` in the server and hit the break point.

=> the break point is not hit.

When I replace the breakpoint with a `debugger;` statement and recompile the server, then the debugger stops as expected. This shows that attaching to the server process is successful.

So I suspect an issue with source maps or the way the launch is configured for the server.
This is the launch.json for the server:
```json
{
	"version": "0.1.0",
	// List of configurations. Add new configurations or edit existing ones.
	"configurations": [
		{
			"name": "Attach",
			"type": "node",
			"request": "attach",
			// TCP/IP address. Default is "localhost".
			"address": "localhost",
			// Port to attach to.
			"port": 6004,
			"sourceMaps": true,
			"outDir": "${workspaceRoot}/../tslint/server"
		}
	]
}
```

Notice that as part of the build process the *.js files and the source maps from the server folder are copied into the `vscode-tslint/tslint/server` folder. 

The path to the sources in the sourcemap `server.js.map` looks OK:
```json
{"version":3,"file":"server.js","sourceRoot":"","sources":["../../tslint-server/src/server.ts"],
```

// CC @dbaeumer 

## Test setup
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/20667303/d93e501e-b568-11e6-8421-a67cd9c5e0b2.png)

data.title: Completions in repl should work even if program is not paused
data.body:
1. Start debugging, have your program not paused
2. Try to get intelli-sense in debug repl - no suggestions
3. Suggestions should be provided even if the program is not paused and there is no stack frame

data.title: Debugger - Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: Parse Error).
Table row gets broken when using back-quoted backslash(\)
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
1.8.0-insider
0b847998d914ff84fd9c13b2972cc8803745c24d
2016-11-25T09:18:45.881Z
1.4.6
53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version: Windows 10 Insider Preview 14971

You can see the 4-th row is not correctly handled by VSCode's markdown preview:

```md
#|a|b
--|--|--
1|`a` | `b`
2|`\a` | `b`
3|`\` | b
4|`\` | `a`
5|`\ ` | `a`
```

#|a|b
--|--|--
1|`a` | `b`
2|`\a` | `b`
3|`\` | b
4|`\` | `a`
5|`\ ` | `a`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311400/20659634/10ed35b0-b588-11e6-81c0-7e41f76448dd.png)

The 5-th line just appends a white space after `\` and it prevents from breaking the table row.

data.title: Telemetry not being disabled
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Linux, Windows.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Disable Telemetry.

I have disabled telemetry as described in the [FAQ](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/supporting/faq#_how-to-disable-telemetry-reporting). I have set the following properties in the settings:

```
"telemetry.enableCrashReporter": false,
"telemetry.enableTelemetry": false
```

Now despite of this, when I log my network traffic (with Wireshark) I can see that Visual Studio Code periodically contacts vortex.data.microsoft.com. This is a known server used for telemetry purposes. I have opted out of the telemetry and information is still sent, why? What information is exchanged? 

The FAQ describes:
> If you don’t wish to send usage data to Microsoft, you can set the telemetry.enableTelemetry setting to false.

To me this means that no telemetry connections should be made, because I would assume that continuous connections to the server can still easily be used to collect information for product usage tracking even if no actual private data is being collected by the application itself.

data.title: Log errors from feature providers as external
data.body:
Fixes #15374

When promises from language feature providers are rejected, we currently call `onUnexpectedError` which ends up calling error telemetry service that logs the error as a telemetry event.
There are 2 reasons why we wouldn't want this

- It is noise when we triage the error telemetry events because these errors are external as far as the core product is concerned.
- It may contain PII.

data.title: File tree in Explorer creates some confusion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Window 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open any project with multiple folders and files in it.
2.  Issue is folder and files on the same level looks as if files are inside (children) that folder. Check the screenshot below.
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5352277/20656558/3c6dc24c-b554-11e6-97d2-ba468f82088d.png)

`+config` and `shared` folder are on the same level as other files (app.component.* files). But when we look at it (`ignoring the right arrow beside folder name`) it seems the `app.component.*` files are inside `shared` folder.

data.title: Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10
- dotnet --version: 1.0.0-preview2-1-003177

Steps to Reproduce:

1. sudo sh -c 'echo "deb [arch=amd64] https://apt-mo.trafficmanager.net/repos/dotnet-release/ yakkety main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/dotnetdev.list'
2. sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv-keys 417A0893
3. sudo apt-get update
4. sudo apt-get install dotnet-dev-1.0.0-preview2.1-003177
5. mkdir hwapp
6. cd hwapp
7. dotnet new
8. dotnet restore
9. dotnet run (this runned fine)
10. head to https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders download the .deb which will download the vscode-insiders build
11. open the folder you created in the hwapp example
12. place a breakpoint in the Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");
13. Press F5 or Click the Debug Icon on the left and click on the run icon

![debugger error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13945178/20654636/3d8dc688-b502-11e6-8ebb-e60ca1f22314.png)

Associate with their signatures, to enable us jump through different blocks in a quicker manner.
Thanks :)

data.title: Editor change decorations don't go away after committing those changes
data.body:
- Add lines to a file and save the file
- See the green markers on the left for additions
- Commit the changes in that file
- In insiders, the green markers are still there until vscode is reloaded

In stable, they go away after the commit.

data.body:

- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Hover over HTML or CSS paramter:
![hovertip](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10902904/20651624/4cb63176-b4ae-11e6-9c2b-6762c8fa167f.gif)

2. Toggling editor.paramterHints does not change the behavior.

The desired outcome is the disable the popup-on-hover tip, but retain the typing tip suggestions.

data.title: vscode 1.8.0 throws Request CSS/colorSymbols failed with message: Cannot read property 'findColorSymbols' of undefined when launching in debug mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insiders
- Commit: 0b847998d914
- Node: 6.5.0

- OS Version:
Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. npm install -g yo generator-code
2. yo code
3. New Extension (TypeScript)
4. download the vscode.d.ts from master and place it in node_modules/vscode/vscode.d.ts (will not be auto installed) 
5. open with vscode insiders and press F5

Hi, I am trying to refactor an extension to use SnippetString for completion (https://github.com/aurelia/vscode-extension/issues/25), but the extension keeps crashing on the error "Request CSS/colorSymbols failed with message: Cannot read property 'findColorSymbols' of undefined" on line 103 of internal/process/next_tick.js. I guess this is because the CSS or HTML language server is crashing, but I'm not 100% sure because I get no call stack, but I guess it because it also happens in an empty project. I tried it once from an empty vscode extension project and that results in the same error.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.2
- OS Version: win 10 x64

**integrated terminal  Scroll bar error**

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ctrl+` show the "integrated terminal"
2. Execute  command  such as "gulp"
3. Ctrl+` hide the "integrated terminal"
4. After a while  Ctrl+` show the "integrated terminal"

and resize window also has some issues 


![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1540211/20648070/e5eaa74a-b4d7-11e6-8820-806728146684.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1540211/20648075/10a70410-b4d8-11e6-9359-ff99561ebc88.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1540211/20648080/3b0ee16e-b4d8-11e6-84e0-456f50a8e47a.png)
